intro: Epidendrum oncidioides var. perplexum, commonly known as the perplexing epidendrum, is a tropical orchid native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its pendulous, showy inflorescences that bear numerous small, fragrant flowers in shades of white, yellow, and orange. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees and deriving moisture and nutrients from the air and rain. This variety is appreciated by orchid enthusiasts for its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
